references.paper_title: Inductive representation learning on large graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces GraphSAGE, a widely used inductive graph neural network model.
This paper introduces Graph Attention Networks (GATs), which are another important type of GNNs that consider node attention mechanisms.
This paper introduces simplified graph convolutional networks (SGCs), which improve efficiency and performance of GCNs.
This paper introduces Hyperbolic Graph Convolutional Neural Networks (HGCNs), which address limitations of Euclidean GNNs by using hyperbolic spaces.
This paper introduces Spiking Graph Convolutional Networks (SGCNs), which are one of the few existing works that explore spiking neural networks for graph data.
